ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Contains some commonly used categorical variable encoders, such as 'LabelEncoder' and 'OneHotEncoder'. Inspired by the encoders implemented in Python 'sklearn.preprocessing' package (see <http://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/preprocessing.html>).

Contains some commonly used categorical variable encoders, such as 'LabelEncoder' and 'OneHotEncoder'. Inspired by the encoders implemented in Python 'sklearn.preprocessing' package (see <http://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/preprocessing.html>).

name: r-catencoders
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '0.1.1' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-catencoders
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/CatEncoders_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/CatEncoders/CatEncoders_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 74a66c700f65da394742cdc58a39e20b9175bba6aa98857cfa88296a00fe3ce1

build:
  number: 4
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-matrix >=1.2_6
    - r-data.table >=1.9.6
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-matrix >=1.2_6
    - r-data.table >=1.9.6

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('CatEncoders')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('CatEncoders')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=CatEncoders
  license: GPL-2.0-or-later
  summary: Contains some commonly used categorical variable encoders, such as 'LabelEncoder'
    and 'OneHotEncoder'. Inspired by the encoders implemented in Python 'sklearn.preprocessing'
    package (see <http://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/preprocessing.html>).
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2'
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: CatEncoders
# Type: Package
# Title: Encoders for Categorical Variables
# Version: 0.1.1
# Author: nl zhang
# Maintainer: nl zhang <setseed2016@gmail.com>
# Description: Contains some commonly used categorical variable encoders, such as 'LabelEncoder' and 'OneHotEncoder'. Inspired by the encoders implemented in Python 'sklearn.preprocessing' package (see <http://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/preprocessing.html>).
# License: GPL-2 | GPL-3
# LazyData: TRUE
# Imports: Matrix (>= 1.2-6), data.table (>= 1.9.6), methods
# RoxygenNote: 5.0.1
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2017-03-08 03:14:25 UTC; nl
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2017-03-08 08:22:03
